solution_line_template: Cassy can pack {jars_per_box_1} x {num_boxes_1} = <<{jars_per_box_1}*{num_boxes_1}={packed_1}>>{packed_1} jars of jam in the {num_boxes_1} boxes.
She can also pack {jars_per_box_2} x {num_boxes_2} = <<{jars_per_box_2}*{num_boxes_2}={packed_2}>>{packed_2} jars of jam in the {num_boxes_2} boxes.
A total of {packed_2} + {packed_1} = <<{packed_2}+{packed_1}={total_packed}>>{total_packed} jars of jam can be packed in the boxes.
So, {total_jars} - {total_packed} = <<{total_jars}-{total_packed}={jars_left}>>{jars_left} jars of jam will be left unpacked.
